channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023071146
item.description:
Report X-2023071146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on two of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The caps on two of the bottles were loose and the contents could be seen protruding from the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage and then brought to QA to be worked on.

item.title: Report X-2023071121
item.description:
Report X-2023071121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap became loose during transit, while unloading it began to leak. We cleaned up the spilled product with neutralizer and secured the soiled clean up materials and package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071088
item.description:
Report X-2023071088

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking, QA was called and package was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Cap had come loose during transit causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was put into a lined tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071086
item.description:
Report X-2023071086

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found on dock with a wet spot on it. QA picked it up and put it in a red tote. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that the lid was loose and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in an upright position and in a red tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023070483
item.description:
Report X-2023070483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS DUE TO RECENT UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMONDS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX ORAL SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST SHIPPING BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED TO THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY AND WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.title: Report X-2023071038
item.description:
Report X-2023071038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At some point in transit, the cap on one of the bottles came loose after the bottle was dented. The package was placed in a spill tote and then brought to QA. DescribePack: The bottle inside was dented and it had a loose cap. Due to the contents corrosive nature, the box was being eaten through. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was placed in a spill tote to prevent further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023070463
item.description:
Report X-2023070463

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMONDS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX ORAL SOLUTION. THE TOTAL COMBINED AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE PACKAGE WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST SHIPPING BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED TO THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY AND WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.title: Report X-2023070319
item.description:
Report X-2023070319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN 82 POUND PACKAGE THAT WAS WET. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED THE BOX WAS WET DUE TO CONDENSATION FROM DRY ICE. THERE WERE NO ADDITIONAL CONTENTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE, ONLY 70 POUNDS OF DRY ICE. ON THE OUTER BOX HANDWRITTEN IN RED MARKER IS 30 LBS OF BLOCK, TOTAL WEIGHT 82 LBS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED.

item.title: Report X-2023070967
item.description:
Report X-2023070967

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ONE 1 GAL BOTTLE OF ASP CIDEX OPA WAS BENT/CRUSHED DURING TRANSIT CAUSING CAP TO COME LOOSE AND INTERNAL LIQUID CONTENTS TO SPILL THROUGHOUT PKG. PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING AND WILL BE HELD AT THE STATION WAITING FOR PGH DISPOSITION. DescribePack: CAP CAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SIX INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE DIAMONDS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY. EACH OF THOSE SIX INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX ORAL SOLUTION. THE TOTAL COMBINED AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE PACKAGE WAS 6000 ML (203 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST SHIPPING BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED TO THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY AND WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER, BUT WAS NOT FLOWN IN THE AIR NETWORK.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 55 gallon drum of ethyl alcohol (un1170) releasing 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023061447
item.description:
Report X-2023061447

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKER IN A PACKAGE CAR ALONG THE BELT. RESPONDER DISCOVRED IT WAS TWO HAZMATS THAT WERE PLACED IN PLASTIC BAGS ASSUMABLY BY THE DRIVER. RESPONDER NOTICED THEY WERE LABELED AS CORROSIVES. RESPONDER PUT ON HIS PPE AND BEGAN TO PUT THE HAZMATS INTO SPILL TUBS. THERE WAS NO LIQUID ON THE GROUND OR IN THE PACKAGE CAR SO HE TOOK THEM BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: RESPONDER GOT A CALL FOR A HAZMAT. RESPONDER PUT PPE ON AND USED DECISION TREE. RESPONDER PUT IT ON THE BACK OF THE TUG AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
